content: Hey there.
Not so good. I had a small accident today.
I hit a parked car while backing out of my driveway.
Yeah, I'm fine. But now I have to pay for the damages.
I'm not sure yet. I'm waiting for the garage to give me an estimate.
Me too. It's always something. Last month, I had to fix my roof.
Yes, I did. But it was a lot of money.
Thanks, me too. It seems like every time I turn around, something else needs fixing.
Yeah, I suppose you're right. Thanks for listening.
Hey, thanks for letting me crash here last night. It was nice to spend some time with you.
Well, I wanted to talk about last night. It was kind of weird, we ended up spooning. I hope it wasn't uncomfortable for you.
Yeah, I know. It's just that I don't want things to be weird between us now.
Thanks, that makes me feel better. So, did you want to do something today?
Actually, there is something on my mind. Remember when we talked about my friends gossiping about me behind my back? Well, I found out who it was and it really hurt me.
Yeah, I think I do. It's just frustrating because I thought they were my friends, but they were talking about me behind my back the whole time. It makes me wonder if anyone else is doing the same.
Thanks, that means a lot. I guess it's just hard to shake off the feeling of betrayal.
Hey there, how's it going?
Well, to be honest, not so great. I confirmed my suspicions about my friends.
I found out they've been gossiping about me behind my back. It's really been getting to me.
Yeah, it's been tough. But I'm grateful to have a friend like you to talk to about it.
Thanks, I appreciate that. It's just frustrating because I thought they were my friends.
You're right. I just need to focus on the people who are there for me and who truly care about me.
Ugh, don't remind me. Yeah, I had to pay for it and it was not cheap. But, I'm just grateful that no one was hurt and it wasn't worse than it was.
Thanks, you're too kind. And don't forget, you're going to do great on your first day of school. Just remember, everyone is in the same boat.
Hey there, Neighbors B! How are you doing today?
I totally understand. It can be nerve-wracking starting something new, but just remember that everyone else is in the same boat as you. They're all starting new too.
Don't worry about that. You're just as capable as anyone else in that school. You'll do great.
No problem at all. Hey, speaking of making mistakes, remember when I backed out of my driveway and hit a parked car?
Yeah, it did. I ended up paying for the damages, but it taught me to always be extra careful when backing out of my driveway.
Definitely. And remember, just take it one step at a time tomorrow. You got this!
Hi, neighbor. How are you doing today?
I'm doing okay, just feeling a bit frustrated.
Well, I was out jogging earlier today and a police car drove by me really slowly. It made me feel uncomfortable, like I was being profiled or something.
Yeah, it's just frustrating to feel like I have to constantly be on guard and prove myself just because of the color of my skin.
Exactly. But at the same time, I don't want to let it hold me back or let it affect my daily life.
Definitely. It's just a reminder of the work that still needs to be done in terms of racial equality.
Agreed. It's conversations like these that help raise awareness and bring about change.
Yes, I do. How did it go?
That's great to hear! I'm glad I could help.
Yeah, that was a tough situation, but I'm glad you confronted them and stood up for yourself.
It does, but knowing that I have allies like you makes it a little bit easier to handle.
Definitely. It's important to look out for one another.
